h1.span: Grade Guidelines for Semester 2 and Y2 (End of Year) during Remote Learning in 2020 due to Covid-19 School Closure

div.div: Posted by Phil Smart on 4/17/2020 4:00:00 PM

div.h4: Click here for Grade Guidelines for Semester 2 an Y2 (End of Year) during reomote Learing in 2020 due to Covid-19 School Closure

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Grade Guidelines for Semester 2 and Y2 (End of Year) during Remote Learning in 2020 due to Covid-19 School Closure

div.div: Posted by Robert M. Tull, Jr. Ed.D. on 4/17/2020 4:00:00 PM

div.p: A message from Dr. Tull -COVID-19 Student Letter# 4 2020.pdf

a.aria-label: Go to comments for COVID-19 Student Letter# 4 - April 17, 2020

h1.span: Covid-19 Update to Community: Spring Break

div.div: Posted by Robert Cloutier on 4/3/2020 3:05:00 PM

div.p:
Dear Parents/Guardians,
We truly praise everyones commitment and adaptability to this massive and successful remote undertaking over these past three weeks. We all miss the social bonds: from the simple hallway conversations among friends to the more intense exuberance of performing on the stage or field with our crews or teammates. May our Spring Break next week, beginning Monday, April 6th and returning Tuesday, April 14th, be filled with solace, respite, and plenty of sunshine for us to absorb to refresh our resolve.
I am sorry that I dont presently have more definitive answers to all of our outstanding questions given the open-ended stay-at-home order. As our state and federal leaders direct us to flatten the curve, making predictions beyond today or next week is not solely within our control. We are confident, though, that together we will make the best decisions for our students, staff, and entire community. We are constantly planning and adapting to the changing circumstances. Here are some key updates and areas being further contemplated:

-NJSLA standardized testing has been canceled for this school year. Therefore, April 23rd and April 24th will be instructional school days for everyone.* (Should remote school days be extended beyond the Governors declaration of April 17th, April 23rd will be PM-Wheel classes and April 24th will be AM-Wheel classes.)
-We are conversing with other schools concerning best practices in grading.High school grades have a different significance than K-8 grades, relevant to students graduation requirements and future goals. For now, the focus of assessment is to remain on learning with supportive feedback. No student will be graded as failing for their efforts to learn remotely. We also understand the importance of the integrity of grades for students transcripts, future employment, college admissions, and awards or scholarships. We will continue to research best practices, should changes be necessary.

p.br:
-We will continue to postpone school activities and events as necessary.After weeks of working with the travel agent, we have established a new date for the class of 2020 Senior Trip, while being assured by the travel agency that a full refund for students or parents will be available.
If your child is experiencing emotional difficulties during this unprecedented time of isolation, please have them reach out to a guidance counselor or a Child Study Team case manager. Team members will be monitoring their email over Spring Break. Perform Care of New Jersey also offers mental health services that you can access at home. If you feel that your child requires immediate assistance, contact the National Suicide Prevention Life Line (1-800-273-8255) and notify the police.
We continue to update our district website, under the tab Covid-19 Updates, with vital information pertaining to health updates, technology, communication and any other school closure details.
Please directly email teachers, counselors, or administrators with questions rather than make phone calls to school offices or extensions.

*There were no snow days this year, not even a delayed opening! The conversion of these to instructional days creates some flexibility to achieve the required number of school days. I always dreamed that if I became a superintendent, I would order school closed for a weather-too-nice day. If I have any discretion, I will recommend Memorial Day weekend be extended to a longer weekend to enjoy the holiday.
Respectfully,
Robert S. Cloutier, J.D.
Superintendent

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Covid-19 Update to Community: Spring Break

div.div: Posted by Robert M. Tull, Jr. Ed.D. on 4/3/2020 2:30:00 PM

div.h3: Click here for a message from Dr. Tull

a.aria-label: Go to comments for COVID-19 Student Letter# 3 2020

h1.span: Notification of Remote Learning being Extended

div.p: Eastern Camden County Regional School District will continue the Remote School Day Learning plan until further notice in alignment with Governor Murphys Shelter in Place order.

p.span: Remote classes will continue through Friday, April 3, 2020. We will observe the Spring Break on the school calendar from Monday, April 6, 2020 through Monday, April 13, 2020. The remote class schedule is expected to resume on Tuesday, April 14, 2020 pending further declarations from Governor Murphy.

School activities are being postponed to later dates or being canceled as deadlines approach. Administrators are working with activity advisors to communicate updates and changes with students and parents as new information is confirmed.

We understand there may be an exceptional need for assistance on campus for items such as working papers. Requests for appointments to visit campus any weekday from 12:30pm to 2:00pm may be made through this
We appreciate everyones
very best efforts and commitment to safeguarding the health and well-being of our students, our families, and our surrounding community. Please contact us through email with questions or concerns.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Notification of Remote Learning being Extended

div.div: Posted by Robert M. Tull, Jr., Ed.D. on 3/23/2020

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Covid-19 Parent Letter 3/23

p.span: Dear Parents/Guardians-

We appreciate the support from everyone in our community for our transition to remote school days. We commend our students, parents, and staff for the cooperation and collaboration for the initial weeks efforts. Our teaching staff, support staff, and administrators are fully committed to fostering life-long learning and connection. We are all balancing growing, comforting, and coping as we all face the uncertain challenges ahead.

Governor Murphys stay-at-home order will impact district and building operations in the immediate. Campus access is suspended until new protocols are developed consistent with forthcoming guidance from the NJDOE that are compliant with the stay-at-home order. The only on-campus activity on Monday will be operations for delivering food to the homes of free-and-reduced lunch eligible families, and essential maintenance personnel to monitor the physical plant.

On Monday, March 23, Dr. Tull will be sending a more detailed letter with important updates to the progress made transitioning building activities and services to remote application. Subsequently, we hope to announce opportunities for limited campus access, if permitted to do so as we process the new executive order. But only after establishing protocols designed with an abundance of caution.
We continue to update our district website with vital information as it pertains to technology, communication and any other school closure details under
Please directly email teachers, counselors, or administrators with questions rather than phone calls to school offices or extensions.

This is unchartered territory. We will continue to seek feedback from students, parents, and staff as we support one another. Take care, we are sending all our best wishes for your family and friends.
Respectfully,
Robert S. Cloutier, J.D.
Superintendent

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Covid-19 Update to Community: 'Stay-at-Home' Order

h1.span: Remote Learning Day Info for Parents and Students - Update 3/19/20

div.p: Click here for the -Remote Learning Day Info for Parents and Students - Update 3/19/20

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Remote Learning Day Info for Parents and Students - Update 3/19/20

div.div: Posted by Robert Cloutier on 3/13/2020 4:30:00 PM

p.span: Eastern Regional High School will activate the district

on Monday, March 16, 2020 through Friday March 27, 2020. We are tentatively scheduled to reopen on Monday, March 30th, for a normal school day. Remote Learning Days will begin at 8:00am on Monday, March 16, 2020 which is Day 2 of our rotating bell schedule. Please refer to the district
to determine class meeting times. Classes will meet Monday through Friday according to the schedule.

All field trips, athletics events and practice, and other extracurricular activities are also cancelled. School district administration will keep all families and staff informed as additional information develops. A plan for free and reduced lunch meals will be forthcoming.
It is important to note that there has been no report of any student or staff member being infected, or directly exposed to infection, to date.

Following our receipt of information from the NJ Department of Education, the administrative and educational staff in all our schools began working on plans to deliver on-going educational programming during an extended school closure. While it wont be possible to replicate an in-school learning environment, our educators are committed to keeping our students engaged and supported throughout the duration of the closure.

This situation has evolved rapidly over the last two weeks. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation during this time as we work together in taking the recommended steps to maintain student education while protecting the safety of our school communities.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Remote School Day Activation

h1.span: Covid-19 Update: Remote School Day Plan

div.div: Posted by Robert Cloutier on 3/13/2020 8:25:00 AM

p.span: Covid-19 Update: Remote School Day Plan

The plan includes direct interaction between students and teachers each day. This will be a new learning experience for us all, and I know our cooperation and joint commitment to the plan will successfully get us through these trying circumstances. It is our hope that the plan will maintain the integrity of the remainder of the school year. All students, especially our seniors, deserve to enjoy all of the achievements they have earned, right through to the graduation ceremony in June.

We are embarking on this ship together with all hands on deck. The news and circumstances are changing from moment-to-moment, and guide us as we evaluate all school activities and operations. As of this writing, extracurricular activities will continue unless State officials inform us that they must be canceled. Please stay posted to all announcements on our webpage and through our apps communication platform for up-to-the-minute updates on changes to school activities.
To all our health and well-being, I am grateful for everyones efforts.
Respectfully,
Robert S. Cloutier, J.D.
Superintendent
